identificationModule.briefTitle: Correlation Between BMI and Craniovertebral Angle and Their Impact on Hand Grip Strength and Neck Functional Disability in Egyptian University Student
identificationModule.officialTitle: Correlation Between BMI and Craniovertebral Angle and Their Impact on Hand Grip Strength and Neck Functional Disability in Egyptian University Student

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: lecturer of internal physical therapy , Ahram Cadian University

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
Objective: To find the relation between cranio-vertebral angle and hand grip strength in university student mobile users.

Design: cross sectional study. Setting: Ahram Candian University Subjects:100 male and female university students with age ranged from 20 to 30 years old will participate in this study.

Intervention: cross sectional study to detect the relation between cranio-vertebral angle and hand grip strength in university student mobile users.

Main measures:

* FHP app (Pyeongtaek, South Korea) mobile application
* Hand dynamometer (the JAMAR® Hydraulic Hand) (Lupton-Smith et al.,2022)
* Mechanical height and weight scale
* Visual Analogue Scale
* Arabic Neck Disability Index Results: The results will be obtained via one-way analyses of variance (ANOVA).

armGroups.label: Group (A):
interventionNames: Other: • FHP app (Pyeongtaek, South Korea) mobile application

armGroups.label: Group (B):
interventionNames: Other: • FHP app (Pyeongtaek, South Korea) mobile application

interventions.name: • FHP app (Pyeongtaek, South Korea) mobile application
interventions.description: FHP app (Pyeongtaek, South Korea) mobile application ,is mobile application to asses cranio vertebral angle

primaryOutcomes.measure: craniovertebral angle will measured by FHP (Forward Head Posture ) mobile application
primaryOutcomes.description: It is a mobile application which is objective to detect the cervical posture by measuring the CV angle. It is an application that requires an Android version 4.0 or higher installed on a smartphone

primaryOutcomes.measure: Hand grip strength will measured by Hand dynamometer (the JAMAR® Hydraulic Hand)
primaryOutcomes.description: it is tool used to asses hand grip strength

primaryOutcomes.measure: Pain level will measured by Visual Analogue Scale
primaryOutcomes.description: VAS is a line with a length of 10 where one end (right) means no pain and the other means severe unbearable pain. Each patient was asked to put a mark on the line that mostly describe his or her pain intensity.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Neck functional disability will assess by Arabic Neck Disability Index
primaryOutcomes.description: it consist of 10 questions in total, including ones about pain intensity, personal care, lifting, reading, headaches, driving, concentration, work, sleeping, and recreation Each item is scored from 0 (no disability) to 5 (total disability)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* • Their ages will range from 20-30 years old.

  * Their BMI will be between than 20- 30kg/m2.
  * All of them suffer from mild degree of neck pain.
  * The subjects complain from neck pain for 1 month ago
* Exclusion criteria:

Exclusion criteria were a history of any of the following condition:

* inflammatory diseases or any rheumatic disorders,
* a history of vertebral fractures
* surgical spinal fixation.
* •any neurological disorders like MS
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: 100 male and female patients Their ages will range from 20-30 years old. Their BMI will be between than 20- 30kg/m2, All of them suffer from mild degree of neck pain and They complain from neck pain for 1 month ago
